desc: This course provides an on-campus immersion experience for students interested in improving their oral language proficiency. Students engage in small and large group discussion, give individual and group oral presentations, and review grammar and registers of language. They also explore the notions of communicative competence and oral proficiency in order to become more effective speakers. Taught in French. Prerequisite: French 232, 235, or equivalent. Offered during Interim. Counts toward film studies concentration.
name: Speaking of French
notes: Open to all students who meet the requirements.
title: Speaking
